Questions.answer: His gas cylinder is empty, and there is a power cut

His gas cylinder is empty, and there is a power cut
He prefers using a kerosene stove

Why does Amma want the water boiled?
options: She wants to drink tea herself
She needs hot water for guests

options: He wants to buy a new stove immediately

Questions.answer: It is nice and better than standing in the rain

activity_b.text: Hey, what are you doing?
Why are you sitting outside like this?
Ah, long story.
I’m boiling water on this rusty old kerosene stove.
Seriously?
That’s annoying.
Do you usually boil water like this?
No, I don’t.
I normally use a gas cooker or the electric kettle, but today everything is upside down.
What happened?
Power cut?
Yeah.
The power just went off again.
And not just a normal one.
The whole neighbourhood is out.
Even the shops nearby are dark.
I checked the street; half the people are outside like it’s a village meeting.
Ha, typical Sri Lankan situation.
Everyone comes out and starts talking!
Exactly.
My uncle from next door is already discussing politics with the vegetable seller. ****
They’ve been shouting for twenty minutes. ****
So why are you boiling water now?
Amma wants to make tea.
You know how she is—whatever happens, tea must be made.
That sounds like every Sri Lankan mother.
And to make things worse, the gas cylinder is also empty.
So I had to drag out this old stove from the storeroom.
I didn’t even know it still worked.
Poor thing.
At least the weather is nice.
It’s better than standing in the rain.
True.
Actually, this feels a bit relaxing.
No TV, no Wi-Fi, no noise.
Maybe the power cut is telling you to slow down.
Maybe!
But once the water boils, I'm making a nice hot cup of tea for both of us.
Eyy, good idea.
At least something positive came out of this drama.
